quoteText: The way for a young man to rise is to improve himself in every way he can, never suspecting that anybody wishes to hinder him.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quoteText: We think the Dred Scott decision is erroneous. We know the court that made it has often overruled its own decisions, and we shall do what we can to have it overrule this.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quoteText: Knavery and flattery are blood relations.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quoteText: Some single mind must be master, else there will be no agreement in anything.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quoteText: I have talked with great men, and I do not see how they differ from others.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quoteText: These men ask for just the same thing, fairness, and fairness only. This, so far as in my power, they, and all others, shall have.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quoteText: Upon the subject of education, not presuming to dictate any plan or system respecting it, I can only say that I view it as the most important subject which we, as a people, can be engaged in.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quoteText: Illinois surpasses every other spot of equal extent upon the face of the globe in fertility of soil and in the proportionable amount of the same which is sufficiently level for actual cultivation.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quoteText: If ever I feel the soul within me elevate and expand to those dimensions not wholly unworthy of its Almighty Architect, it is when I contemplate the cause of my country, deserted by all the world beside, and I standing up boldly and lone and hurling defiance at her victorious oppressors.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quoteText: A private soldier has as much right to justice as a major-general.
author: Abraham Lincoln
